leaf_cluster.leaf_cluster_name: 计算科学方法论与数值计算生态
leaf_cluster.typical_objects: 稀疏矩阵/算子, 网格与离散系统, PDE/ODE, 误差/收敛数据
leaf_cluster.task_chain: 离散化→求解→误差/稳定性→加速→验证→可复现
leaf_cluster.tool_form: 数值库/求解器框架 + 自动微分/可微分计算 + HPC

unit.unit_name: 随机模拟与蒙特卡洛（含MCMC/SMC）
unit.coverage_tools: MC/MCMC、采样器、方差缩减、随机微分、并行采样

queries: [WEB] Parallel Monte Carlo simulation tools github

tools.name: MARS
tools.one_line_profile: Variance reduction library for large model training
tools.detailed_description: The official implementation of MARS (Maximum Auxiliary Reduction System), a method leveraging variance reduction techniques to optimize the training of large-scale machine learning models.

tools.name: BayesNewton
tools.one_line_profile: JAX-based library for approximate Bayesian inference and Gaussian processes
tools.detailed_description: A Gaussian process library built on JAX that provides a unifying view of approximate Bayesian inference as variants of Newton's method, enabling efficient inference in probabilistic models.

tools.name: PF-net
tools.one_line_profile: Particle Filter Network implementation for state estimation
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of Particle Filter Network (PF-net), integrating particle filters with neural networks for state estimation tasks in dynamic systems.

tools.name: hamiltorch
tools.one_line_profile: PyTorch-based library for Riemannian Manifold Hamiltonian Monte Carlo
tools.detailed_description: A library for performing Riemannian Manifold Hamiltonian Monte Carlo (RMHMC) and inference in Bayesian neural networks, built on top of PyTorch.

tools.name: image-restoration-sde
tools.one_line_profile: Image restoration using Mean-Reverting Stochastic Differential Equations
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of a method for image restoration (e.g., shadow removal) using Mean-Reverting Stochastic Differential Equations, as presented at ICML 2023.

tools.name: rbpf-gmapping
tools.one_line_profile: Rao-Blackwellized Particle Filter for Grid-Based FastSLAM
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB implementation of the Rao-Blackwellized Particle Filter (RBPF) algorithm applied to Grid-Based FastSLAM for robotic mapping.

tools.name: pymc3-hmm
tools.one_line_profile: Hidden Markov Models implementation in PyMC3
tools.detailed_description: A library providing Hidden Markov Model (HMM) implementations and utilities within the PyMC3 probabilistic programming framework.

tools.name: StochVolModels
tools.one_line_profile: Analytics and Monte Carlo simulations for stochastic volatility models
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for pricing analytics and Monte Carlo simulations of various stochastic volatility models, including Heston and log-normal SV models.

tools.name: SGRLD
tools.one_line_profile: Stochastic Gradient Riemannian Langevin Dynamics implementation
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of Stochastic Gradient Riemannian Langevin Dynamics (SGRLD), a method for scalable Bayesian inference on Riemannian manifolds.

tools.name: PyRenew
tools.one_line_profile: Multi-signal Bayesian renewal modeling for epidemiology
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for multi-signal Bayesian renewal modeling using JAX and NumPyro, designed for estimating reproductive numbers and other epidemiological parameters.

tools.name: MCDC
tools.one_line_profile: Monte Carlo Dynamic Code for neutron transport
tools.detailed_description: A pure Python Monte Carlo neutron transport code designed for research into transient simulations and advanced computing architectures.

tools.name: HMCMT2D
tools.one_line_profile: 2D Magnetotelluric probabilistic inversion using Hamiltonian Monte Carlo
tools.detailed_description: A software package for the 2D probabilistic inversion and uncertainty quantification of Magnetotelluric (MT) data using the Hamiltonian Monte Carlo method.

tools.name: pSGLD
tools.one_line_profile: Preconditioned Stochastic Gradient Langevin Dynamics implementation
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of the Preconditioned Stochastic Gradient Langevin Dynamics (pSGLD) algorithm for efficient Bayesian learning in large-scale models.

tools.name: Commander
tools.one_line_profile: Gibbs sampling estimator for CMB posterior exploration
tools.detailed_description: Commander is an Optimal Monte-carlo Markov chAiN Driven EstimatoR which implements fast and efficient end-to-end CMB (Cosmic Microwave Background) posterior exploration through Gibbs sampling.

tools.name: PyTissueOptics
tools.one_line_profile: Monte Carlo simulations of light transport in 3D media
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for performing Monte Carlo simulations of light transport in complex 3D tissue models and media.

tools.name: geobipy
tools.one_line_profile: Geophysical Bayesian Inference in Python
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for geophysical Bayesian inference, providing tools for probabilistic inversion of geophysical data.

tools.name: BayesPrism
tools.one_line_profile: Bayesian inference of tumor microenvironment composition
tools.detailed_description: A fully Bayesian inference method for estimating tumor microenvironment composition and gene expression from bulk RNA-seq data.

tools.name: Vanilla_PF_ICP
tools.one_line_profile: Iterative Closest Point via Particle Filtering
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB implementation of the Iterative Closest Point (ICP) algorithm enhanced with particle filtering for robust point cloud registration.

tools.name: pyroms
tools.one_line_profile: Python tools for Regional Ocean Modeling System
tools.detailed_description: A collection of Python tools for pre- and post-processing data for the Regional Ocean Modeling System (ROMS).

tools.name: astroABC
tools.one_line_profile: Approximate Bayesian Computation SMC sampler
tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation of an Approximate Bayesian Computation (ABC) Sequential Monte Carlo (SMC) sampler for parameter estimation in astrophysics and other fields.

tools.name: SMC.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Sequential Monte Carlo (SMC) algorithms for posterior approximation in DSGE models
tools.detailed_description: A Julia library implementing Sequential Monte Carlo (SMC) methods, specifically designed for estimating Dynamic Stochastic General Equilibrium (DSGE) models. It provides parallelized sampling capabilities for high-dimensional parameter spaces in economic modeling.

tools.name: GWInferno
tools.one_line_profile: Hierarchical inference framework for gravitational-wave astronomy
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for performing hierarchical Bayesian inference on gravitational-wave populations using NumPyro. It leverages Hamiltonian Monte Carlo (HMC) and NUTS samplers to analyze merger rate densities and population parameters.

tools.name: GOMC
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-optimized Monte Carlo for molecular simulations
tools.detailed_description: A high-performance, parallel molecular simulation engine optimized for GPUs. It performs Metropolis Monte Carlo simulations for phase equilibria and physical properties of fluids and polymers, supporting various ensembles (NVT, NPT, GCMC).

tools.name: xpdeint
tools.one_line_profile: Stochastic partial differential equation solver for quantum optics
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based solver for partial differential equations (PDEs) and stochastic PDEs, serving as the successor to the XMDS package. It is widely used in quantum optics and Bose-Einstein condensate research for numerical simulations.

tools.name: Probabilistic-Backpropagation
tools.one_line_profile: Scalable Bayesian inference for deep neural networks
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of Probabilistic Backpropagation (PBP), a method for scalable Bayesian inference in deep neural networks. It allows for the estimation of uncertainty in predictions and learning of hyper-parameters.

tools.name: FlowKet
tools.one_line_profile: Variational Monte Carlo framework for quantum many-body systems
tools.detailed_description: A TensorFlow-based framework for running Variational Monte Carlo (VMC) simulations of quantum many-body systems. It supports deep learning-based wave function ansätze (NQS) for studying ground states and dynamics.

tools.name: DeepBSDE
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning solver for high-dimensional PDEs and BSDEs
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for solving high-dimensional partial differential equations (PDEs) and backward stochastic differential equations (BSDEs) using deep learning methods. It implements algorithms suitable for physics and financial mathematics problems.

tools.name: filterflow
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable particle filtering library in TensorFlow
tools.detailed_description: An extensible TensorFlow library for differentiable particle filtering (SMC). It allows for end-to-end learning of state-space models and particle filter parameters within a deep learning framework.

tools.name: PyMultiNest
tools.one_line_profile: Python interface for MultiNest Bayesian inference tool
tools.detailed_description: A Python interface for the MultiNest Nested Sampling algorithm, widely used in astrophysics and cosmology for Bayesian inference and model selection. It handles multi-modal posterior distributions efficiently.

tools.name: jaxns
tools.one_line_profile: Nested sampling and probabilistic programming in JAX
tools.detailed_description: A probabilistic programming and nested sampling library built on JAX. It provides fast, differentiable nested sampling for Bayesian inference and model evidence calculation, suitable for high-dimensional scientific problems.

tools.name: TuringPatterns.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Turing patterns simulation solver for GeoStats.jl
tools.detailed_description: A simulation solver for generating Turing patterns within the GeoStats.jl framework. It is used for geostatistical modeling and simulation of spatial patterns based on reaction-diffusion systems.

tools.name: Stheno.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Flexible Gaussian Process library for Julia
tools.detailed_description: A probabilistic programming library for Gaussian Processes (GPs) in Julia. It provides a compositional interface for building complex GP models and performing inference, suitable for time series analysis and spatial modeling.

tools.name: ParticleFilters.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Particle filtering implementation for POMDPs in Julia
tools.detailed_description: A library implementing particle filters (Sequential Monte Carlo) for the POMDPs.jl ecosystem. It provides standard particle filters for state estimation in partially observable Markov decision processes.

tools.name: KernelDensityEstimate.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Kernel Density Estimation with multiscale Gibbs sampling
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package for Kernel Density Estimation (KDE) that uses multiscale Gibbs sampling for product approximation. It is used for non-parametric probability density estimation in robotics and statistics.

tools.name: bayestracking
tools.one_line_profile: Bayesian filter tracking framework for robotics
tools.detailed_description: A C++ framework for Bayesian tracking, implementing filters like Unscented Kalman Filter (UKF), Extended Kalman Filter (EKF), and Particle Filters. It is designed for object tracking and state estimation in robotics and autonomous systems.

tools.name: pyroomacoustics
tools.one_line_profile: Audio signal processing and room acoustics simulation
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for audio signal processing and room acoustics simulation. It provides tools for simulating room impulse responses, beamforming, and source separation, widely used in acoustic research and engineering.

tools.name: LaplacesDemon
tools.one_line_profile: Complete environment for Bayesian inference in R
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive R package for Bayesian inference, offering a wide variety of MCMC algorithms (including Metropolis, Hamiltonian Monte Carlo, etc.), Laplace approximation, and tools for model specification and validation.

tools.name: stanford-corenlp-python
tools.one_line_profile: Python wrapper for Stanford CoreNLP
tools.detailed_description: A Python wrapper for the Stanford CoreNLP library, enabling natural language processing tasks such as tokenization, part-of-speech tagging, named entity recognition, and parsing. It facilitates the use of CoreNLP in Python-based scientific data processing pipelines.

tools.name: multibody-state-estimation
tools.one_line_profile: State estimators for multibody dynamics
tools.detailed_description: A C++ library providing state estimation algorithms for multibody dynamics systems. It includes implementations of particle filters and factor-graph based estimators, useful for robotics and mechanical system analysis.

tools.name: DeepProbLog
tools.one_line_profile: Neuro-symbolic probabilistic logic programming framework
tools.detailed_description: DeepProbLog is an extension of the probabilistic logic programming language ProbLog that integrates deep learning with probabilistic logic, enabling neural predicates for complex reasoning and inference tasks.

tools.name: ProbLog
tools.one_line_profile: Probabilistic Logic Programming Language
tools.detailed_description: ProbLog is a probabilistic logic programming language that allows for the specification of complex probabilistic models and performs inference tasks, suitable for logic-based scientific modeling.

tools.name: allesfitter
tools.one_line_profile: Inference framework for exoplanet light curves and radial velocities
tools.detailed_description: allesfitter is a comprehensive wrapper for modeling and fitting photometric and radial velocity data, integrating nested sampling (dynesty) and MCMC (emcee) for exoplanet research.

tools.name: Cassandra
tools.one_line_profile: Atomistic Monte Carlo simulation software
tools.detailed_description: Cassandra is an open-source Monte Carlo software package designed for atomistic simulations of fluids and solids, capable of handling complex molecules and various ensembles.

tools.name: diff-SAT
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable Probabilistic SAT and Answer Set Programming Solver
tools.detailed_description: diff-SAT is a solver for Probabilistic Answer Set Programming and Probabilistic SAT solving, utilizing differentiable satisfiability techniques for inference and model counting.

tools.name: MrBayes
tools.one_line_profile: Bayesian inference for phylogenetic and evolutionary models
tools.detailed_description: MrBayes is a prominent program for Bayesian inference and model choice across a wide range of phylogenetic and evolutionary models, utilizing MCMC methods.

tools.name: ising-gpu
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated 2D Ising Model Monte Carlo simulation
tools.detailed_description: A high-performance implementation of Monte Carlo simulations for the 2D Ising Model using CUDA, enabling large-scale lattice physics simulations.

tools.name: OpenTOPAS
tools.one_line_profile: Monte Carlo tool for particle simulation in medical physics
tools.detailed_description: OpenTOPAS is a Monte Carlo tool based on Geant4, designed for particle simulation with a focus on medical physics applications such as proton therapy and radiation transport.

tools.name: MIDAS
tools.one_line_profile: Multiple Imputation with Denoising Autoencoders
tools.detailed_description: MIDAS is a tool for multiple imputation of missing data using denoising autoencoders, facilitating approximate Bayesian inference for incomplete datasets in scientific analysis.

tools.name: pysmc
tools.one_line_profile: Sequential Monte Carlo library based on PyMC
tools.detailed_description: pysmc implements Sequential Monte Carlo (SMC) methods, leveraging the PyMC framework to provide advanced sampling capabilities for probabilistic modeling.

tools.name: QInfer
tools.one_line_profile: Bayesian inference for quantum parameter estimation
tools.detailed_description: QInfer is a library for performing Bayesian inference via Sequential Monte Carlo (SMC), specifically tailored for quantum information processing and parameter estimation experiments.

tools.name: ReactiveMP.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Reactive message-passing Bayesian inference engine
tools.detailed_description: ReactiveMP.jl is a high-performance Julia package for Bayesian inference using reactive message passing on factor graphs, enabling real-time and efficient probabilistic modeling.

tools.name: RxInfer.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Automated Bayesian inference on factor graphs
tools.detailed_description: RxInfer.jl provides a user-friendly interface for automated Bayesian inference on factor graphs, built on top of ReactiveMP.jl, supporting real-time processing and complex probabilistic models.

tools.name: Alz-IDProteinExplorer
tools.one_line_profile: Simulation and visualization of Intrinsically Disordered Proteins
tools.detailed_description: A tool for the visualization, simulation, and manipulation of Intrinsically Disordered Proteins (IDPs) using Gibbs sampling, specifically focused on Alzheimer's related proteins.

tools.name: dice
tools.one_line_profile: Exact inference for discrete probabilistic programs
tools.detailed_description: Dice is a probabilistic programming system that performs exact inference for discrete probabilistic programs, utilizing binary decision diagrams for efficiency.

tools.name: slda
tools.one_line_profile: Cython implementation of Gibbs sampling for supervised Latent Dirichlet Allocation
tools.detailed_description: A Python library implementing Gibbs sampling for Supervised Latent Dirichlet Allocation (sLDA), providing efficient statistical inference for topic modeling with supervision.

tools.name: DiffEqApproxFun.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Bridge between ApproxFun.jl and DifferentialEquations.jl for spectral PDE methods
tools.detailed_description: A component of the SciML ecosystem that facilitates the interaction between ApproxFun.jl (function approximation) and DifferentialEquations.jl, enabling pseudospectral discretizations for partial differential equations.

tools.name: DiffEqBayes.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Bayesian parameter estimation for differential equations
tools.detailed_description: An extension package for the SciML ecosystem that interfaces with probabilistic programming libraries (Stan, Turing, DynamicHMC) to perform Bayesian inference and parameter estimation for differential equations.

tools.name: DiffEqFinancial.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Financial modeling extensions for DifferentialEquations.jl
tools.detailed_description: A domain-specific library within the SciML ecosystem providing problem specifications and solvers for common stochastic differential equation models used in quantitative finance (e.g., Heston, Black-Scholes).

tools.name: DiffEqGPU.jl
tools.one_line_profile: GPU acceleration for SciML differential equation solvers
tools.detailed_description: A library providing GPU-accelerated ensemble simulations and solvers for the DifferentialEquations.jl ecosystem, enabling high-performance parallel solving of ODEs and SDEs.

tools.name: DiffEqNoiseProcess.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Stochastic noise process definitions for SDE simulations
tools.detailed_description: A library containing definitions and generators for various stochastic noise processes (Wiener, Ornstein-Uhlenbeck, etc.) used in the simulation of stochastic differential equations within the SciML ecosystem.

tools.name: DifferentialEquations.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Comprehensive suite for solving differential equations in Julia
tools.detailed_description: A high-performance, feature-rich library for solving ordinary, stochastic, delay, and differential-algebraic equations. It serves as the core solver suite for the SciML ecosystem.

tools.name: HighDimPDE.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning and stochastic methods for high-dimensional PDEs
tools.detailed_description: A package implementing Deep BSDE (Backward Stochastic Differential Equations) and Feynman-Kac methods to solve high-dimensional partial differential equations, overcoming the curse of dimensionality.

tools.name: JumpProcesses.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Simulation of jump processes and Gillespie algorithms
tools.detailed_description: A library for simulating jump processes, including Gillespie's SSA and various approximations (Tau-leaping), integrated with the SciML differential equation solvers for hybrid systems.

tools.name: StochasticDelayDiffEq.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Solvers for stochastic delay differential equations (SDDEs)
tools.detailed_description: A specialized library within the SciML ecosystem for solving stochastic delay differential equations, handling systems with both noise and time delays.

tools.name: StochasticDiffEq.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Solvers for stochastic differential equations (SDEs)
tools.detailed_description: The primary solver library for stochastic differential equations in the SciML ecosystem, offering a wide range of adaptive and fixed-step methods for Ito and Stratonovich SDEs.

tools.name: diffeqpy
tools.one_line_profile: Python interface for DifferentialEquations.jl
tools.detailed_description: A Python wrapper that allows users to access the high-performance solvers of Julia's DifferentialEquations.jl directly from Python.

tools.name: diffeqr
tools.one_line_profile: R interface for DifferentialEquations.jl
tools.detailed_description: An R package that provides an interface to Julia's DifferentialEquations.jl, enabling R users to utilize high-performance differential equation solvers.

tools.name: pyross
tools.one_line_profile: Inference and simulation for epidemiological models
tools.detailed_description: A library for numerical simulation, Bayesian inference, and optimal control of compartmental epidemiological models (e.g., SIR, SEIR), supporting age-structured populations.

tools.name: LAHMC
tools.one_line_profile: Look Ahead Hamiltonian Monte Carlo implementation
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB implementation of the Look Ahead Hamiltonian Monte Carlo (LAHMC) algorithm, a probabilistic inference method that improves upon standard HMC by reducing random walk behavior.

tools.name: Theano
tools.one_line_profile: Pioneering library for defining and evaluating mathematical expressions
tools.detailed_description: A legacy but historically significant Python library for efficient numerical computation and deep learning, allowing definition, optimization, and evaluation of mathematical expressions involving multi-dimensional arrays. (Predecessor to Aesara/PyTensor).

tools.name: traversability_mapping
tools.one_line_profile: Bayesian Generalized Kernel Inference for terrain mapping
tools.detailed_description: A C++ implementation of Bayesian Generalized Kernel Inference (BGKI) for building traversability maps from sensor data, used in robotics and autonomous systems for environmental modeling.

tools.name: VIforSDEs
tools.one_line_profile: Variational inference for stochastic differential equations
tools.detailed_description: A Python library implementing variational methods for fast approximate inference in stochastic differential equations, enabling parameter estimation for stochastic dynamic models.

tools.name: AdvancedHMC.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Modular implementation of Hamiltonian Monte Carlo algorithms
tools.detailed_description: A robust and efficient Julia library implementing advanced Hamiltonian Monte Carlo (HMC) algorithms (including NUTS), serving as a core sampling engine for the Turing.jl probabilistic programming ecosystem.

tools.name: AdvancedMH.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Metropolis-Hastings algorithms for Turing.jl
tools.detailed_description: A Julia library providing robust implementations of Random Walk Metropolis-Hastings (RWMH) and other MH variants, designed as a modular component for probabilistic programming.

tools.name: AdvancedPS.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Sequential Monte Carlo and Particle MCMC algorithms
tools.detailed_description: A Julia library implementing Sequential Monte Carlo (SMC) and Particle MCMC methods, enabling inference in state-space models and other sequential probabilistic models.

tools.name: DynamicPPL.jl
tools.one_line_profile: DSL for dynamic probabilistic programming in Julia
tools.detailed_description: The core domain-specific language (DSL) and backend for Turing.jl, allowing users to define complex probabilistic models with dynamic control flow and connect them to inference engines.

tools.name: MCMCChains.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Utility functions for summarizing and visualizing MCMC simulation results
tools.detailed_description: A Julia library providing types and functions to analyze, summarize, and visualize the results of Markov Chain Monte Carlo (MCMC) simulations, serving as a backend for the Turing.jl ecosystem.

tools.name: Turing.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Probabilistic programming library for Bayesian inference
tools.detailed_description: A flexible probabilistic programming library in Julia that allows users to define probabilistic models and perform Bayesian inference using various MCMC and variational inference algorithms.

tools.name: TuringCallbacks.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Callback utilities for the Turing.jl probabilistic programming ecosystem
tools.detailed_description: A library providing convenient callback functions to be used during sampling in Turing.jl, enabling tasks such as logging, checkpointing, and real-time monitoring of inference processes.

tools.name: TuringGLM.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Bayesian Generalized Linear Models for Turing.jl
tools.detailed_description: A library enabling the specification of Bayesian Generalized Linear Models (GLMs) using a formula syntax within the Turing.jl probabilistic programming framework.

tools.name: automcmc
tools.one_line_profile: NumPyro-compatible implementation of automatically tuned MCMC samplers
tools.detailed_description: A Python library providing JAX implementations of autoStep and other automatically tuned MCMC samplers, designed to be compatible with the NumPyro probabilistic programming framework.

tools.name: gibbs-rtss
tools.one_line_profile: Gibbs-Sampling based Rauch-Tung-Striebel Smoother
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB implementation of a Gibbs sampling-based Rauch-Tung-Striebel Smoother for state estimation, developed by UCL-SML.

tools.name: fmcmc
tools.one_line_profile: A friendly MCMC framework for R
tools.detailed_description: An R package providing a flexible and user-friendly framework for implementing Markov Chain Monte Carlo (MCMC) algorithms for statistical inference.

tools.name: CollisionPro
tools.one_line_profile: Collision probability distribution estimation framework
tools.detailed_description: A framework for estimating collision probability distributions via deep temporal difference learning, aimed at providing explainable value functions in reinforcement learning contexts.

tools.name: UppASD
tools.one_line_profile: Atomistic spin dynamics and Monte Carlo simulation tool
tools.detailed_description: A simulation software package for performing atomistic spin dynamics and Monte Carlo simulations of Heisenberg spin systems to study magnetic properties.

tools.name: SteinDreamer
tools.one_line_profile: Variance reduction for Text-to-3D via Stein Identity
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of the SteinDreamer algorithm which utilizes Stein Identity for variance reduction in score distillation sampling, improving Text-to-3D generation tasks.

tools.name: Contour-SGLD
tools.one_line_profile: Adaptive importance sampling for multi-modal distributions
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of Contour Stochastic Gradient Langevin Dynamics, an adaptive importance sampling algorithm designed for efficient simulation of multi-modal distributions.

tools.name: tfcausalimpact
tools.one_line_profile: Causal Impact implementation using TensorFlow Probability
tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation of the Causal Impact algorithm (originally R) built on top of TensorFlow Probability, used for estimating the causal effect of a designed intervention on a time series.

tools.name: DPFRL
tools.one_line_profile: Discriminative Particle Filter Reinforcement Learning
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of Discriminative Particle Filter Reinforcement Learning (DPFRL) for handling complex partial observations in reinforcement learning environments.

tools.name: pfrnns
tools.one_line_profile: Particle Filter Recurrent Neural Networks
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of Particle Filter Recurrent Neural Networks (PF-RNNs), a model architecture that integrates particle filtering with recurrent neural networks for sequential data modeling.

tools.name: pyGridSampler
tools.one_line_profile: Adaptive grid-based sampling method
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool for adaptive grid-based sampling using iterative batch sizes, developed by ZuckermanLab for efficient exploration of configuration spaces.

tools.name: pyvbmc
tools.one_line_profile: Variational Bayesian Monte Carlo in Python
tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation of the Variational Bayesian Monte Carlo (VBMC) algorithm, designed for posterior and model inference, especially efficient for expensive black-box likelihoods.

tools.name: vbmc
tools.one_line_profile: Variational Bayesian Monte Carlo in MATLAB
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB toolbox implementing the Variational Bayesian Monte Carlo (VBMC) algorithm for efficient posterior and model inference with computationally expensive likelihood functions.

tools.name: Sim.DiffProc
tools.one_line_profile: R package for SDE simulation and analysis
tools.detailed_description: An R package for symbolic and numerical computations on scalar and multivariate systems of stochastic differential equations (SDEs), supporting simulation, estimation, and visualization.

tools.name: stan2tfp
tools.one_line_profile: Interface between Stan and TensorFlow Probability
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight interface allowing the compilation of Stan programs to the TensorFlow Probability backend, enabling the use of TFP's inference algorithms with Stan models.

tools.name: gmcl
tools.one_line_profile: General Monte Carlo Localization for mobile robots
tools.detailed_description: A probabilistic localization library for mobile robots integrating Adaptive Monte Carlo Localization (AMCL) with multiple particle filter algorithms (Optimal, Intelligent, Self-adaptive) for improved real-time performance.

tools.name: aemcmc
tools.one_line_profile: Automated sampler construction for Aesara graphs
tools.detailed_description: A Python library that automates the derivation and construction of MCMC samplers for statistical models represented as Aesara graphs.

tools.name: numpyro-oop
tools.one_line_profile: Object-oriented wrapper API for NumPyro
tools.detailed_description: A wrapper library providing an object-oriented API for working with NumPyro models, simplifying model management and inference workflows.

tools.name: pytorch-pl-variance-reduction
tools.one_line_profile: Low-variance gradient estimates for Plackett-Luce distribution
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of low-variance black-box gradient estimation techniques for the Plackett-Luce distribution, useful for optimization in probabilistic models.

tools.name: cosmopower
tools.one_line_profile: Machine learning accelerated Bayesian inference for cosmology
tools.detailed_description: A library for machine learning-accelerated Bayesian inference, specifically designed to emulate cosmological power spectra and accelerate parameter estimation in cosmology.

tools.name: pylda
tools.one_line_profile: Gibbs sampling implementation for Latent Dirichlet Allocation
tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation of Gibbs sampling for Latent Dirichlet Allocation (LDA), serving as a statistical tool for topic modeling and inference.

tools.name: Langevin-dynamics
tools.one_line_profile: Gradient-based Markov Chain Monte Carlo sampling algorithms
tools.detailed_description: A collection of implementations for gradient-based Markov Chain Monte Carlo (MCMC) approaches, including Metropolis-Adjusted Langevin Algorithm (MALA) and Unadjusted Langevin Algorithm (ULA), for sampling from complex distributions.

tools.name: pnp
tools.one_line_profile: Probabilistic Neural Programming library
tools.detailed_description: A library for Probabilistic Neural Programming, enabling the combination of neural networks with probabilistic programming constructs for structured prediction and inference tasks.

tools.name: pyrodigal
tools.one_line_profile: Python interface to Prodigal ORF finder
tools.detailed_description: A Python interface and Cython bindings for Prodigal, a tool for gene prediction (ORF finding) in genomes and metagenomes, optimized with SIMD instructions.

tools.name: SDE-higham
tools.one_line_profile: Algorithms for stochastic differential equations
tools.detailed_description: A Python/NumPy implementation of basic numerical algorithms for solving stochastic differential equations (SDEs), based on Higham's algorithmic descriptions.

tools.name: MXFusion
tools.one_line_profile: Modular Probabilistic Programming on MXNet
tools.detailed_description: A modular probabilistic programming library built on top of MXNet, designed to facilitate the development of probabilistic models and inference algorithms.

tools.name: pyrouge
tools.one_line_profile: Python interface for ROUGE summarization evaluation
tools.detailed_description: A Python interface to the ROUGE package, used for evaluating automatic summarization and other natural language processing tasks by comparing generated text against reference summaries.

tools.name: HuMoLiRe
tools.one_line_profile: Pedestrian Dead-Reckoning Particle Filter Map-aided system
tools.detailed_description: A Pedestrian Dead-Reckoning (PDR) Particle Filter Map-aided system that leverages human motion likelihood in indoor spaces to estimate position, provided as a software tool with associated datasets.

tools.name: MCmatlab
tools.one_line_profile: Monte Carlo simulation for light propagation in turbid media
tools.detailed_description: A numerical simulation tool implemented in MATLAB for Monte Carlo propagation of light in turbid media, useful for biomedical optics and physics simulations.

tools.name: hamiltonian-monte-carlo
tools.one_line_profile: Hamiltonian Monte Carlo implementation in TensorFlow
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of the Hamiltonian Monte Carlo (HMC) sampling algorithm using Google's TensorFlow, enabling gradient-based sampling for probabilistic models.

tools.name: pmbs
